Package Model

Class TurnManager

java.lang.Object
Model.TurnManager
public class TurnManager extends Object
Class used to manage the flow of turns in a Uno Game match Provides a good help to keep trace of the player that has to play and the last card played
Author:
D'annibale Luigi, Venturini Daniele

      Changes the turn flow from clockwise to anti-clockwise or vice-versa.

    • getPlayer

      public int getPlayer()
      Returns:
      the player who has to play the turn

    • getLastCardPlayed

      public Card getLastCardPlayed()
      Returns:
      the last card played, more precisely a card which has the value of that card and the color (that can be either the same of the card or the one chosen after a wild card)

    • updateLastCardPlayed

      public void updateLastCardPlayed(Card lastPlayed)
      Parameters:
      lastPlayed - the card that has been played

    • updateLastCardPlayed

      public void updateLastCardPlayed(Value value, Color color)
      Parameters:
      value - the value of the last card played
      color - the color of the last card played (or the color that has been chosen after a wild)

    • antiClockwiseTurn

      public boolean antiClockwiseTurn()
      Returns:
      true if the turn goes anti-clockwise

    • setPlayer

      public void setPlayer(int player)
      Parameters:
      player - the player that has to play the turn
